TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
On Tantares-Lite, I quite like the idea, but it will be difficult to narrow down the parts exactly.

My first thought would be only the R-7 and Soyuz alone, but then may want the Progress, then for Progress may want the station parts, then for station parts may want Proton, then...

It will spiral out of necessity quickly.

This is basically why I'd like to leave only non-existent in stock parts, like 1.25m 2-seater capsule of Soyuz, as well as spherical OM, the R-7 radial tanks and engine (1.25m for stock compatibility). N-1 tanks are also unique, being sort of "adapters" between different sizes. LK capsule can provide ~1.25m 2-seater landing solution, while also keeping good ol' Soviet style. 0.625 LES is versatile for both stock and custom pods, though TKS parts might not be that useful. Except, of course, big radial monoprop parts. In that way the parts will also keep their stockalike-ness (unlike Tantares SM having LFO, monoprop and an engine inside) while filling the gaps in stock. 1.875m parts would be also great, but I can see why they shouldn't get to the Tantares Light, the whole new size isn't that stock after all.

Anyway, it's you who will decide, just my two cents.

EDIT: you can make Salyut with stock parts (Mk1 lander as the middle section, Hitchiker as main segment and 1.25 fuselage as the docking section), so such redundant parts might not be needed. Proton can be made with new stock parts pretty easy and such. So, brief, TL will keep modularity AND low part count.

Edited August 29, 2015 by Niemand303

On Tantares-Lite, I quite like the idea, but it will be difficult to narrow down the parts exactly.

My first thought would be only the R-7 and Soyuz alone, but then may want the Progress, then for Progress may want the station parts, then for station parts may want Proton, then...

It will spiral out of necessity quickly.

I'd standby that for the initial version the cutting needs to be very liberal every part has to fill a functional niche that stock parts don't and keep out extra sizes, most of the combo parts that can be easily made by slapping enough stock parts together(with rare exceptions), and parts that exist for aesthetic reasons. I was planning to start assembling and playing with trimmed packs after I finished updating hermes, but don't anyone wait on me I'm a slowpoke.

but just off the top of my head going by folder...

Vostok: radial mini monoprop tanks, 1.25m monoprop engine, waykeeper radial lfo engines

Soyuz: 1.25m 2 kerbal command pod, 1.25m 1 kerbal orbital module (basically a crew can), 0.625m inline decoupler/parachute

TKS: radial monoprop engines, radiator/monoprop tanks (rare combo part exception), nose engine rescaled to 0.625m (and the top node removed because nothing would fit on top), cargo bay rescaled to 2.5m, inline decoupler/parachute rescaled to 1.25m

Fuji: 2.5m 2 kerbal command pod

LK: 1.25m 2 kerbal lander can

Cygnus: 2x1 panel sun tracking solar panels, 0.625m monoprop engine

Fobos: 0.625m inline monoprop tank

Everything else is either redundant with stock aside from looks, a special size and is also redundant when rescaled, or "I forget what is in this folder and I need to go eat breakfast soon..."

by the way I didn't even scratch TantaresLV

Just 1.875m parts could also make a good stand alone pack since like making a lite version finding and pulling them all in from all four corners of the main packs yourself is tedious and you are never sure if you got them all...

I combed through my craft files and removed any R7-derived boosters, leaving just the payloads. Then I installed the new R7 parts and rebuilt the first two stages as a subassembly. Made for a very orderly transition.
